Today is ‚ÄòRandom Act of Kindness Day‚Äô.

Sports mentor Aimee presented Liz from Jigsaw NI with a bouquet of flowers as we facilitated her group of elderly on our active ageing programme.

Thank you for everything you do Liz. Keep up the good work.

#RandomActsofKindnessDay https://t.co/nsQhQHlH32

Active Ageing is a free 12 week programme designed to help with the prevention of falls for those aged 65 and over.

It includes a range of exercises aimed at focusing on improving strength and balance in order to help reduce the risk of a fall occurring.

https://t.co/7RVRIzL39e https://t.co/2kBJbjntBa

With the support of @TNLComFund  our charity has successfully launched an Active Ageing sports programme.

The programme uses walking football, cricket and netball to support London residents over 50.

To find out how you can get involved, email office@changefdn.org.uk üìß https://t.co/h4MOerig0n

This week alone we have worked with:
- 548 p7 pupils across 12 primary schools delivering our Honour Roll programme
- 63 young people aged 14-18 participating in 4 of our eHoops personal development programme
- 93 aged 50+ taking part in our active ageing 'Live Long' programme https://t.co/e3XpDLMLfT

#LoveToPedal üö¥ SASP‚Äôs Active Ageing Manager is supporting the Occupational Therapy Department & the Eliot Ward at #MusgrovePark who will be using the #LoveToPedal seated #cycling programme to keep patients active during their stay! https://t.co/KQgfRUZd5Y #BeActive #Somerset https://t.co/0hn974S4X7

Karbon Homes is partnering with Durham County Cricket Foundation to bring their Active Ageing Programme to residents over 55, living in our Retirement Living schemes across North Durham. 
https://t.co/65fHfDkH1V

What will you TAKEPART in today? On the programme today we have FREE taster sessions on dance, table tennis, core exercise, active ageing, ballet, skateboarding, football, aikido, wheelchair basketball, HIIT‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs something for all ages and abilities #takepartBH #Activeliving

Whilst the adrenaline kicked in as they got closer to the Oval, it was with the help of friends and colleagues who spurred them on from Carrick, thanks to board members Catherine (and her two dogs) and Deirdre, Joe and the group from our Active Ageing programme https://t.co/mU6Gh74daD
